Job Posting:174717 - Position: W26 Actuarial Co-op 174717B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/29/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 10/22/2025 02:55 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization City Province / State Country Athene Toronto Ontario Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description Job Req: R253306 2026 - Winter W26 Actuarial Co-op 174717B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months In-Person CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List We are driven to do more. More for our customers and the financial professionals who offer our products. If you are driven to do more and love the challenge of pursuing more, Athene is your kind of company. You will find we offer more than the basics to create an inclusive and dynamic work environment at our various locations. Purpose: At Athene, we are driven to do more. We are a leading retirement services company that issues, reinsures, and acquires retirement savings products designed for the increasing number of individuals and institutions seeking to fund retirement needs. Athene provides products in the retirement savings market, including retail and fixed indexed annuity products as well as institutional products, such as funding agreements. We see every day as a new opportunity to measure ourselves against the best - and then we don't stop until we've set the bar even higher. We're ready to help you achieve more. Athene has established a Canadian Service Company to continue to attract and develop professional talent and to support business units in the US and Bermuda locations. We are seeking to fill a actuarial student co-op roles in our downtown Toronto location. Start and end time of this opportunity are flexible but will ideally encompass a minimum of 4 consecutive months from January - April 2026. The Actuarial Student Co-op role will focus on one of our various available roles which include: 1. 2. 3. Experience Analysis EBS Reporting CFT/Hedging These roles will have the opportunity to work with various departments across the organization. Accountabilities: • Assist in the preparation of annual experience analysis process, including gathering of data, updating excel model inputs, compiling output, and summarizing results in presentable format for senior and executive management. • Assist with the production and reporting of Bermuda Economic Balance Sheet (EBS) results. • Assist with the daily/weekly derivative collateral process. • Assist with monthly collateral deal calculations. • Contribute to enhancing documentation across all business, including company memos and excel tables. • Ensure proper controls are built and completed to maintain a strong control environment. Work with other team members and aid in ad hoc projects as needed. • Drive. Discipline. Confidence. Focus. Commitment. Learn more about working at Athene. Athene is a Military Friendly Employer! Learn more about how we support our Veterans. Athene is committed to inclusion and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law. Job Requirements Qualifications and Experience: • Pursuit of a four-year degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, finance, or related field. • • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and effectively meet deadlines. • Strong interpersonal skills, excellent oral and written English language skills required. • Commitment to actuarial exam progress. • Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (specifically Excel) required. • Experience with manipulation and analysis of large data sets preferred. Experience with Python, SQL, SAS, and PowerQuery a bonus. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://athene.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/athene_careers/job/Toronto-Ontario/Actuarial-Co- op_R253306?clientRequestID=0b72db707a9a4dc9aa32b0ef04efc6af Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
